definitions.definition: an empty space in an object, usually with an opening to the object's surface, or an opening that goes completely through an object:
examples: We dug a hole and planted the tree.

definitions.definition: in golf, one of the small circular spaces in the ground into which the ball is hit
in golf, one of the usually 18 areas of play:
to make a hole in something, especially a ship or boat:
examples: A torpedo holed the ship below the water and it quickly sank.
